thread.title: The most Instagrammed foods around the world
thread.title_full: The most Instagrammed foods around the world - Telegraph

author: Hugh Morris
title: The most Instagrammed foods around the world
text: Say what you will about people who Instagram their dinner before even so much as considering raising it to their lips, but their pre-dinner ritual has become as much a part of modern culinary etiquette as pretending to draw on your hand to signal for the bill. And what's more: it's global. As illustrated by the above graphic, taking a photo of your food, drowning it in filters and posting it to social media photo-sharing site Instagram is happening around the world. • Instagram London: the city's most popular spots However, the photogenic foods on our plates are not the same the world over, according to the study of 100,000 Instagram images by Photoworld.com. For example, London, fuelled by the recent pandemonium over patties, is the top city in the world for Instagrammed burgers, followed by New York , then Los Angeles . A photo posted by Laurent Devillechabrolle (@deville92) on Jul 14, 2015 at 8:39am PDT Perhaps surprisingly, it is New York that accounts for the highest percentage share of picturesque bacon (followed by London), while the east coast city also takes the crown for sushi, with LA second, Bangkok third, Milan fourth and Tokyo fifth. • Where to eat in London A photo posted by @itzameirene on Jul 14, 2015 at 9:05am PDT Not all foods were spread quite so thinly across the globe. It seems that currywurst is almost exclusively eaten/photographed in Germany, with all top five cities for Instagramming the sausage meal in Germany. • Where to eat in Berlin A photo posted by amare_sano (@amarealive) on Jul 14, 2015 at 7:08am PDT Similarly, poutine, the Canadian dish of cheese, chips and gravy, was mostly papped in Montreal (its hometown), Toronto, Vancouver, Laval and Ottawa - all Canadian cities. • Extraordinary McDonald's restaurants around the world A photo posted by Virginia Luu (@vluuser) on Jul 13, 2015 at 9:28pm PDT Another London hit is the increasingly popular pulled pork, with the capital taking the top spot of percentage share of pulled pork snaps, with New York second and Melbourne third. A photo posted by B Darius Bothe (@sirtrivial) on Jul 14, 2015 at 12:14am PDT Within the UK, it is hard to gauge any regional variations on food photography, as London dominates the nation's share of Instagram users, however, one point of note is that Leicester is particularly fond of jerk chicken (14 per cent of the UK's jerk chicken images were taken here). Globally, the 10 most Instagrammed and hashtagged foods were... Rank Food 1 Pizza 2 Sushi 3 Steak 4 Burger 5 Bacon 6 Tacos 7 Donuts 8 Ramen 9 Curry 10 Hotdog Follow @telegraphtravel
